intro: Atalanthus longilobus, commonly known as the long-lobed sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its upright, branched stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces vibrant pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Atalanthus longilobus is often found in sandy or gravelly habitats, such as along roadsides and in desert scrublands.
